thread.title: SI: MSU’s Valentine a ‘prime contender’ for top player
thread.title_full: SI: MSU’s Valentine a ‘prime contender’ for top player

author: detroitnews.com
title: SI: MSU’s Valentine a ‘prime contender’ for top player
text:
Michigan State guard Denzel Valentine is coming off a junior season in which he averaged 16.4 points, 7.2 rebounds and 4.8 assists. (Photo: Dale G. Young, Detroit News) 
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Denzel Valentine is Michigan State’s top returning player from last season’s Final Four team.
Sports Illustrated says he also could be one of the best in the country.
The publication has the Spartans’ senior guard as a “prime contender” for national player of the year honors in college basketball, in player projections released Wednesday .
The 6-foot-5 Valentine is coming off a junior season in which he averaged 16.4 points, 7.2 rebounds and 4.8 assists.
“We haven’t seen Valentine on any publications’ preseason All-America first teams,” Sports Illustrated’s Luke Winn wrote, “but SI’s projections view him as a darkhorse POY pick — a statistical monster who could lead the Spartans in points, rebounds and assists. Valentine is a complete, efficient player who can operate on the wing or as an oversized point guard.”
Sports Illusrated separated 15 players into four tiers, with two players — Gonzaga’s Kyle Wiltjer and LSU freshman Ben Simmons — in the front-runners tier. Valentine is one of eight players listed in the second tier for “prime contenders.”
Winn writes that Sports Illustrated’s player projections are based on a bevy of factors, including numerous statistics and coaching tendencies, which you can read here .
Michigan senior guard Caris LeVert didn’t make any of the tiers, but was listed as a player the publication considered.
